Political reform urged in Seoul 
    Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- The solidarity council of civic and social organizations which groups over 290 civic and social organizations in South Korea held a New Year's meeting in Seoul on Jan. 4, according to Seoul-based MBC.
 The permanent representative of the council charged in the meeting that last year social reform failed to make any progress due to the vicious circle of corruption and the scramble in the political camps and called on the civic organizations to take the lead in the political reform in the New Year.
